member.name: T:System.Reflection.AmbiguousMatchException
member.summary: The exception that is thrown when binding to a member results in more than one member matching the binding criteria. This class cannot be inherited.

member.name: M:System.Reflection.AmbiguousMatchException.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class with an empty message string and the root cause exception set to null.

member.name: M:System.Reflection.AmbiguousMatchException.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class with its message string set to the given message and the root cause exception set to null.
member.param: A string indicating the reason this exception was thrown.

member.name: M:System.Reflection.AmbiguousMatchException.#ctor(System.String,System.Exception)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class with a specified error message and a reference to the inner exception that is the cause of this exception.
member.param: The error message that explains the reason for the exception.
The exception that is the cause of the current exception. If the parameter is not null, the current exception is raised in a catch block that handles the inner exception.

member.name: T:System.Reflection.Assembly

member.name: M:System.Reflection.AssemblyName.GetPublicKeyToken
member.summary: Gets the public key token, which is the last 8 bytes of the SHA-1 hash of the public key under which the application or assembly is signed.
member.returns: A byte array that contains the public key token.

member.name: P:System.Reflection.AssemblyName.Name
member.summary: Gets or sets the simple name of the assembly. This is usually, but not necessarily, the file name of the manifest file of the assembly, minus its extension.
member.returns: The simple name of the assembly.

member.name: P:System.Reflection.AssemblyName.ProcessorArchitecture
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that identifies the processor and bits-per-word of the platform targeted by an executable.

member.summary: Sets the public key identifying the assembly.

member.name: M:System.Reflection.AssemblyName.SetPublicKeyToken(System.Byte[])
member.summary: Sets the public key token, which is the last 8 bytes of the SHA-1 hash of the public key under which the application or assembly is signed.
member.param: A byte array containing the public key token of the assembly.

member.name: M:System.Reflection.AssemblyName.ToString
member.summary: Returns the full name of the assembly, also known as the display name.
member.returns: The full name of the assembly, or the class name if the full name cannot be determined.

member.name: P:System.Reflection.AssemblyName.Version
member.summary: Gets or sets the major, minor, build, and revision numbers of the assembly.

member.name: T:System.Reflection.ConstructorInfo
member.summary: Discovers the attributes of a class constructor and provides access to constructor metadata.

member.name: F:System.Reflection.ConstructorInfo.ConstructorName
member.summary: Represents the name of the class constructor method as it is stored in metadata. This name is always ".ctor". This field is read-only.

member.name: M:System.Reflection.ConstructorInfo.Equals(System.Object)
member.summary: Returns a value that indicates whether this instance is equal to a specified object.
member.returns: true if equals the type and value of this instance; otherwise, false.
member.param: An object to compare with this instance, or null.

member.name: M:System.Reflection.ConstructorInfo.GetHashCode
member.summary: Returns the hash code for this instance.
member.returns: A 32-bit signed integer hash code.

member.name: M:System.Reflection.ConstructorInfo.Invoke(System.Object[])
member.summary: Invokes the constructor reflected by the instance that has the specified parameters, providing default values for the parameters not commonly used.
member.returns: An instance of the class associated with the constructor.
member.param: An array of values that matches the number, order and type (under the constraints of the default binder) of the parameters for this constructor. If this constructor takes no parameters, then use either an array with zero elements or null, as in Object[] parameters = new Object[0]. Any object in this array that is not explicitly initialized with a value will contain the default value for that object type. For reference-type elements, this value is null. For value-type elements, this value is 0, 0.0, or false, depending on the specific element type.
member.exception: The class is abstract.-or- The constructor is a class initializer.
In the .NET for Windows Store apps or the Portable Class Library, catch the base class exception, , instead.The constructor is private or protected, and the caller lacks .
The array does not contain values that match the types accepted by this constructor.
The invoked constructor throws an exception.
An incorrect number of parameters was passed.
Creation of , , and types is not supported.
The caller does not have the necessary code access permission.

member.name: F:System.Reflection.ConstructorInfo.TypeConstructorName
member.summary: Represents the name of the type constructor method as it is stored in metadata. This name is always ".cctor". This property is read-only.

member.summary: Gets a structure that can be used to obtain the type and value of the current named argument.
member.returns: A structure that can be used to obtain the type and value of the current named argument.

member.name: T:System.Reflection.CustomAttributeTypedArgument

member.summary: Gets the type of the argument or of the array argument element.
member.returns: A object representing the type of the argument or of the array element.

member.summary: Gets the value of the argument for a simple argument or for an element of an array argument; gets a collection of values for an array argument.
member.returns: An object that represents the value of the argument or element, or a generic of objects that represent the values of an array-type argument.

member.name: P:System.Reflection.FieldInfo.IsAssembly
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether the potential visibility of this field is described by ; that is, the field is visible at most to other types in the same assembly, and is not visible to derived types outside the assembly.
member.returns: true if the visibility of this field is exactly described by ; otherwise, false.

member.name: P:System.Reflection.FieldInfo.IsFamily
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether the visibility of this field is described by ; that is, the field is visible only within its class and derived classes.
member.returns: true if access to this field is exactly described by ; otherwise, false.

member.name: P:System.Reflection.FieldInfo.IsFamilyAndAssembly
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether the visibility of this field is described by ; that is, the field can be accessed from derived classes, but only if they are in the same assembly.
member.returns: true if access to this field is exactly described by ; otherwise, false.

member.name: P:System.Reflection.FieldInfo.IsFamilyOrAssembly
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether the potential visibility of this field is described by ; that is, the field can be accessed by derived classes wherever they are, and by classes in the same assembly.
member.returns: true if access to this field is exactly described by ; otherwise, false.

member.name: P:System.Reflection.FieldInfo.IsInitOnly
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether the field can only be set in the body of the constructor.
member.returns: true if the field has the InitOnly attribute set; otherwise, false.

member.name: P:System.Reflection.FieldInfo.IsLiteral
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether the value is written at compile time and cannot be changed.
member.returns: true if the field has the Literal attribute set; otherwise, false.

member.name: P:System.Reflection.FieldInfo.IsPrivate
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether the field is private.
member.returns: true if the field is private; otherwise; false.

member.name: P:System.Reflection.FieldInfo.IsPublic
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether the field is public.
member.returns: true if this field is public; otherwise, false.

member.name: P:System.Reflection.FieldInfo.IsSpecialName
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether the corresponding SpecialName attribute is set in the enumerator.
member.returns: true if the SpecialName attribute is set in ; otherwise, false.

member.name: P:System.Reflection.FieldInfo.IsStatic
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether the field is static.
member.returns: true if this field is static; otherwise, false.

member.returns: A MethodBase containing information about the method.
member.param: The method's handle.
member.exception: is invalid.

member.name: M:System.Reflection.MethodBase.GetMethodFromHandle(System.RuntimeMethodHandle,System.RuntimeTypeHandle)
member.summary: Gets a object for the constructor or method represented by the specified handle, for the specified generic type.
member.returns: A object representing the method or constructor specified by , in the generic type specified by .
member.param: A handle to the internal metadata representation of a constructor or method.
A handle to the generic type that defines the constructor or method.
member.exception: is invalid.

member.name: M:System.Reflection.MethodBase.GetParameters
member.summary: When overridden in a derived class, gets the parameters of the specified method or constructor.
member.returns: An array of type ParameterInfo containing information that matches the signature of the method (or constructor) reflected by this MethodBase instance.

member.name: M:System.Reflection.MethodBase.Invoke(System.Object,System.Object[])
member.summary: Invokes the method or constructor represented by the current instance, using the specified parameters.
member.returns: An object containing the return value of the invoked method, or null in the case of a constructor.CautionElements of the array that represent parameters declared with the ref or out keyword may also be modified.
member.param: The object on which to invoke the method or constructor. If a method is static, this argument is ignored. If a constructor is static, this argument must be null or an instance of the class that defines the constructor.

An argument list for the invoked method or constructor. This is an array of objects with the same number, order, and type as the parameters of the method or constructor to be invoked. If there are no parameters, should be null.If the method or constructor represented by this instance takes a ref parameter (ByRef in Visual Basic), no special attribute is required for that parameter in order to invoke the method or constructor using this function. Any object in this array that is not explicitly initialized with a value will contain the default value for that object type. For reference-type elements, this value is null. For value-type elements, this value is 0, 0.0, or false, depending on the specific element type.
member.exception: In the .NET for Windows Store apps or the Portable Class Library, catch instead.The parameter is null and the method is not static.-or- The method is not declared or inherited by the class of . -or-A static constructor is invoked, and is neither null nor an instance of the class that declared the constructor.
The elements of the array do not match the signature of the method or constructor reflected by this instance.
The invoked method or constructor throws an exception. -or-The current instance is a that contains unverifiable code. See the "Verification" section in Remarks for .
The array does not have the correct number of arguments.

In the .NET for Windows Store apps or the Portable Class Library, catch the base class exception, , instead.The caller does not have permission to execute the method or constructor that is represented by the current instance.
The type that declares the method is an open generic type. That is, the property returns true for the declaring type.
The current instance is a .

member.name: P:System.Reflection.MethodBase.IsAbstract
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether the method is abstract.
member.returns: true if the method is abstract; otherwise, false.

member.name: P:System.Reflection.MethodBase.IsAssembly
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether the potential visibility of this method or constructor is described by ; that is, the method or constructor is visible at most to other types in the same assembly, and is not visible to derived types outside the assembly.
member.returns: true if the visibility of this method or constructor is exactly described by ; otherwise, false.

member.name: P:System.Reflection.MethodBase.IsConstructor
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether the method is a constructor.
member.returns: true if this method is a constructor represented by a object (see note in Remarks about objects); otherwise, false.

member.name: P:System.Reflection.MethodBase.IsFamily
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether the visibility of this method or constructor is described by ; that is, the method or constructor is visible only within its class and derived classes.
member.returns: true if access to this method or constructor is exactly described by ; otherwise, false.

member.name: P:System.Reflection.MethodBase.IsFamilyAndAssembly
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether the visibility of this method or constructor is described by ; that is, the method or constructor can be called by derived classes, but only if they are in the same assembly.
member.returns: true if access to this method or constructor is exactly described by ; otherwise, false.

member.name: P:System.Reflection.MethodBase.IsFamilyOrAssembly
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether the potential visibility of this method or constructor is described by ; that is, the method or constructor can be called by derived classes wherever they are, and by classes in the same assembly.
member.returns: true if access to this method or constructor is exactly described by ; otherwise, false.

member.name: P:System.Reflection.MethodBase.IsFinal
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether this method is final.
member.returns: true if this method is final; otherwise, false.

member.name: P:System.Reflection.MethodBase.IsGenericMethod
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether the method is generic.
member.returns: true if the current represents a generic method; otherwise, false.

member.name: P:System.Reflection.MethodBase.IsGenericMethodDefinition
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether the method is a generic method definition.
member.returns: true if the current object represents the definition of a generic method; otherwise, false.

member.name: P:System.Reflection.MethodBase.IsHideBySig
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether only a member of the same kind with exactly the same signature is hidden in the derived class.
member.returns: true if the member is hidden by signature; otherwise, false.

member.name: P:System.Reflection.MethodBase.IsPrivate
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether this member is private.
member.returns: true if access to this method is restricted to other members of the class itself; otherwise, false.

member.name: P:System.Reflection.MethodBase.IsPublic
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether this is a public method.
member.returns: true if this method is public; otherwise, false.

member.name: P:System.Reflection.MethodBase.IsSpecialName
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether this method has a special name.
member.returns: true if this method has a special name; otherwise, false.

member.name: P:System.Reflection.MethodBase.IsStatic
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether the method is static.
member.returns: true if this method is static; otherwise, false.

member.name: P:System.Reflection.MethodBase.IsVirtual
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether the method is virtual.
member.returns: true if this method is virtual; otherwise, false.

member.name: P:System.Reflection.MethodBase.MethodImplementationFlags
member.summary: Gets the flags that specify the attributes of a method implementation.
member.returns: The method implementation flags.

member.name: T:System.Reflection.MethodInfo
member.summary: Discovers the attributes of a method and provides access to method metadata.

member.returns: The delegate for this method.
member.param: The type of the delegate to create.

member.summary: Creates a delegate of the specified type with the specified target from this method.
member.returns: The delegate for this method.
member.param: The type of the delegate to create.
The object targeted by the delegate.

member.name: M:System.Reflection.MethodInfo.Equals(System.Object)
member.summary: Returns a value that indicates whether this instance is equal to a specified object.
member.returns: true if equals the type and value of this instance; otherwise, false.
member.param: An object to compare with this instance, or null.

member.name: M:System.Reflection.MethodInfo.GetGenericArguments
member.summary: Returns an array of objects that represent the type arguments of a generic method or the type parameters of a generic method definition.
member.returns: An array of objects that represent the type arguments of a generic method or the type parameters of a generic method definition. Returns an empty array if the current method is not a generic method.
member.exception: This method is not supported.

member.name: M:System.Reflection.MethodInfo.GetGenericMethodDefinition
member.summary: Returns a object that represents a generic method definition from which the current method can be constructed.
member.returns: A object representing a generic method definition from which the current method can be constructed.
member.exception: The current method is not a generic method. That is, returns false.
This method is not supported.

member.name: M:System.Reflection.MethodInfo.GetHashCode
member.summary: Returns the hash code for this instance.
member.returns: A 32-bit signed integer hash code.

member.name: M:System.Reflection.MethodInfo.MakeGenericMethod(System.Type[])
member.summary: Substitutes the elements of an array of types for the type parameters of the current generic method definition, and returns a object representing the resulting constructed method.
member.returns: A object that represents the constructed method formed by substituting the elements of for the type parameters of the current generic method definition.
member.param: An array of types to be substituted for the type parameters of the current generic method definition.
member.exception: The current does not represent a generic method definition. That is, returns false.
is null.-or- Any element of is null.

The number of elements in is not the same as the number of type parameters of the current generic method definition.-or- An element of does not satisfy the constraints specified for the corresponding type parameter of the current generic method definition.
This method is not supported.

member.name: P:System.Reflection.MethodInfo.ReturnType
member.summary: Gets the return type of this method.

member.summary: Returns the hash code for this instance.

member.name: M:System.Reflection.Module.GetType(System.String,System.Boolean,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Returns the specified type, specifying whether to make a case-sensitive search of the module and whether to throw an exception if the type cannot be found.
member.returns: A object representing the specified type, if the type is declared in this module; otherwise, null.
member.param: The name of the type to locate. The name must be fully qualified with the namespace.
true to throw an exception if the type cannot be found; false to return null.
true for case-insensitive search; otherwise, false.
member.exception: is null.
The class initializers are invoked and an exception is thrown.
is a zero-length string.
is true, and the type cannot be found.
requires a dependent assembly that could not be found.
requires a dependent assembly that was found but could not be loaded.-or-The current assembly was loaded into the reflection-only context, and requires a dependent assembly that was not preloaded.
requires a dependent assembly, but the file is not a valid assembly. -or- requires a dependent assembly which was compiled for a version of the runtime later than the currently loaded version.

member.summary: Gets a String representing the name of the module with the path removed.
member.returns: The module name with no path.

member.name: M:System.Reflection.Module.ToString
member.summary: Returns the name of the module.
member.returns: A String representing the name of this module.

member.name: T:System.Reflection.ParameterInfo
member.summary: Discovers the attributes of a parameter and provides access to parameter metadata.

member.summary: Gets the attributes for this parameter.
member.returns: A ParameterAttributes object representing the attributes for this parameter.

member.name: P:System.Reflection.ParameterInfo.CustomAttributes
member.summary: Gets a collection that contains this parameter's custom attributes.
member.returns: A collection that contains this parameter's custom attributes.

member.name: P:System.Reflection.ParameterInfo.DefaultValue
member.summary: Gets a value indicating the default value if the parameter has a default value.
member.returns: The default value of the parameter, or if the parameter has no default value.

member.summary: Gets a value that indicates whether this parameter has a default value.
member.returns: true if this parameter has a default value; otherwise, false.

member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether this parameter is optional.

member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether this is an output parameter.

member.name: P:System.Reflection.ParameterInfo.IsRetval
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether this is a Retval parameter.

member.name: P:System.Reflection.ParameterInfo.Member
member.summary: Gets a value indicating the member in which the parameter is implemented.
member.returns: The member which implanted the parameter represented by this .

member.name: P:System.Reflection.ParameterInfo.Name
member.summary: Gets the name of the parameter.
member.returns: The simple name of this parameter.

member.name: P:System.Reflection.ParameterInfo.ParameterType
member.summary: Gets the Type of this parameter.
member.returns: The Type object that represents the Type of this parameter.

member.name: P:System.Reflection.ParameterInfo.Position
member.summary: Gets the zero-based position of the parameter in the formal parameter list.

member.exception: The Constant table in unmanaged metadata does not contain a constant value for the current property.
The type of the value is not one of the types permitted by the Common Language Specification (CLS). See the ECMA Partition II specification, Metadata.

member.name: M:System.Reflection.PropertyInfo.GetHashCode
member.summary: Returns the hash code for this instance.
member.returns: A 32-bit signed integer hash code.

member.summary: When overridden in a derived class, returns an array of all the index parameters for the property.
member.returns: An array of type ParameterInfo containing the parameters for the indexes. If the property is not indexed, the array has 0 (zero) elements.

member.name: P:System.Reflection.PropertyInfo.GetMethod
member.summary: Gets the get accessor for this property.

member.name: M:System.Reflection.PropertyInfo.GetValue(System.Object)
member.summary: Returns the property value of a specified object.
member.returns: The property value of the specified object.
member.param: The object whose property value will be returned.

member.name: M:System.Reflection.PropertyInfo.GetValue(System.Object,System.Object[])
member.summary: Returns the property value of a specified object with optional index values for indexed properties.
member.returns: The property value of the specified object.
member.param: The object whose property value will be returned.
Optional index values for indexed properties. The indexes of indexed properties are zero-based. This value should be null for non-indexed properties.
member.exception: The array does not contain the type of arguments needed.-or- The property's get accessor is not found.
In the .NET for Windows Store apps or the Portable Class Library, catch instead.The object does not match the target type, or a property is an instance property but is null.
The number of parameters in does not match the number of parameters the indexed property takes.
In the .NET for Windows Store apps or the Portable Class Library, catch the base class exception, , instead.There was an illegal attempt to access a private or protected method inside a class.
An error occurred while retrieving the property value. For example, an index value specified for an indexed property is out of range. The property indicates the reason for the error.

member.name: T:System.Reflection.ReflectionTypeLoadException
member.summary: The exception that is thrown by the method if any of the classes in a module cannot be loaded. This class cannot be inherited.

member.name: M:System.Reflection.ReflectionTypeLoadException.#ctor(System.Type[],System.Exception[])
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class with the given classes and their associated exceptions.
member.param: An array of type Type containing the classes that were defined in the module and loaded. This array can contain null reference (Nothing in Visual Basic) values.
An array of type Exception containing the exceptions that were thrown by the class loader. The null reference (Nothing in Visual Basic) values in the array line up with the exceptions in this array.

member.name: M:System.Reflection.ReflectionTypeLoadException.#ctor(System.Type[],System.Exception[],System.String)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class with the given classes, their associated exceptions, and exception descriptions.
member.param: An array of type Type containing the classes that were defined in the module and loaded. This array can contain null reference (Nothing in Visual Basic) values.
An array of type Exception containing the exceptions that were thrown by the class loader. The null reference (Nothing in Visual Basic) values in the array line up with the exceptions in this array.
A String describing the reason the exception was thrown.

member.name: P:System.Reflection.ReflectionTypeLoadException.LoaderExceptions
member.summary: Gets the array of exceptions thrown by the class loader.
member.returns: An array of type Exception containing the exceptions thrown by the class loader. The null values in the array of this instance line up with the exceptions in this array.

member.name: P:System.Reflection.ReflectionTypeLoadException.Types
member.summary: Gets the array of classes that were defined in the module and loaded.
member.returns: An array of type Type containing the classes that were defined in the module and loaded. This array can contain some null values.

member.summary: The exception that is thrown by methods invoked through reflection. This class cannot be inherited.

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class with a reference to the inner exception that is the cause of this exception.

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class with a specified error message and a reference to the inner exception that is the cause of this exception.
member.param: The error message that explains the reason for the exception.
The exception that is the cause of the current exception. If the parameter is not null, the current exception is raised in a catch block that handles the inner exception.

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class with its message string set to the given message and the root cause exception.
member.param: A String describing the reason this exception was thrown.

member.name: M:System.Reflection.TargetParameterCountException.#ctor(System.String,System.Exception)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class with a specified error message and a reference to the inner exception that is the cause of this exception.
member.param: The error message that explains the reason for the exception.
The exception that is the cause of the current exception. If the parameter is not null, the current exception is raised in a catch block that handles the inner exception.

member.name: T:System.Reflection.TypeInfo
member.summary: Represents type declarations for class types, interface types, array types, value types, enumeration types, type parameters, generic type definitions, and open or closed constructed generic types.

member.name: P:System.Reflection.TypeInfo.DeclaredNestedTypes

member.returns: A collection of the properties defined by the current type.

member.exception: is null.

member.name: M:System.Reflection.TypeInfo.System#Reflection#IReflectableType#GetTypeInfo
member.summary: Returns a representation of the current type as a object.
member.returns: A reference to the current type.
